summary: Fabergé eggs are precious, jeweled eggs made by the Russian company House of Fabergé. About 69 were made, and most were designed by Peter Carl Fabergé. These eggs are famous because they were given as special Easter gifts to Russian emperors and their families. There are 57 eggs still around today, and they are worth a lot of money. People think of them as symbols of wealth and beauty. One of the most well-known is the Imperial Coronation egg.
title: Fabergé egg
